intro: Ouratea opaca, commonly known as the Brazilian evergreen or the Brazilian whitewood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and dense, glossy green foliage. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by distinctive orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
